# Chord: Augmented in D# (Shape: E)

## Description
The augmented chord is a triad built with a root, a major third, and an augmented fifth. In the case of D# augmented chord, which can be played using the shape of an E chord, it consists of the notes D# (root), G (major third), and A# (augmented fifth).

## Notes and Intervals (from the root D#):
- D# (root)
- G (major third)
- A# (augmented fifth)

## Genre and Musical Flavor
The augmented chord is often used in jazz, avant-garde, and classical music. This chord creates tension and has a dissonant quality to it due to the augmented fifth, which sets it apart from major and minor chords. It can add a sense of mystery, suspense, and instability to a musical piece.
